dryopts

Class DryOpts

  • java.lang.Object
    • dryopts.DryOpts

  • public class DryOpts
extends java.lang.Object
    - Dont repeat your (command line) options

    Most option parsers I've seen requires you to mention options twice:

    • either you tell the parser about it before parsing and then check for it afterward,
    • or you declare a variable outside the gotopts loop, and then check for it inside the loop.
    DocOpt is nice, but point one still applies.

    This one is different: it first parses the arguments, then you extract options and positional arguments. This has a few limitations:

    • Doesn't support long options with a single dash, like -version.
    • By default, short options cannot take the remaining chars as argument, like -Lpath (but -L=path works). This can be worked around by supplying a custom is_shortOpt(), but that breaks DRY

    Other features:

    • Can parse, and generate help and usage for, positional arguments. arguments, positional or to an option can be validated or converted, with errors logged.
    • Extensible: new option or argument types can be added at runtime.

    When you find a bug, please open an issue on https://github.com/tormol/dryopts.java

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DryOpts.ArgException
      Is used by ArgType.
      static interface  DryOpts.ArgType<T>
      Convert an argument to an option or positional argument to the desired type, for example an integer or IP address.
      static class  DryOpts.Builder 
      static class  DryOpts.Flag
      An option type that takes no arguments and gives an error if it cannot be removed.
      class  DryOpts.FoundOpt
      Represents an args option that have not been matched yet.
      static class  DryOpts.IntRange
      For arguments that must be an integer
      static class  DryOpts.MultiArg<V>
      An option type that stores every argument and require one.
      static interface  DryOpts.OptType
      Registers found options and decides what should be done with it's present or missing argument.
      static class  DryOpts.OutputFile 
      static class  DryOpts.Regex
      argument must match a regex.
      static class  DryOpts.Set<T>
      argument must be one of the given values.
      static class  DryOpts.Single<V>
      An option type that forgets the previous occurrence when it gets a new one.
      protected static class  DryOpts.ValidOption
      for aligning descriptions in generate_help()

      All arguments that are not an option.
      protected java.lang.StringBuilder errors
      While quitting on the first error is simpler, I think collecting them and printing them at the end is more user friendly, altougt some errors might cause other errors

      Name of the program, for the Usage: string

      Store help information about positional arguments.
      protected java.util.List<DryOpts.ValidOption> validOptions
      For generating help, Can't use a StringBuilder because you need to know the longest long option to line up descriptions.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        get name of the program. If Builder.name() was not set, this is the class name of the bottom of the stack. if the object was constructed on the main thread, that is the class of main().

                                           java.lang.String desc,
                                           OT handler)
        Check for an option and store it for help messages.
        Parameters:
        shortOpt - single-character version, -o
        longOpt - multi-character version, --option
        desc - if not null option is stored and will be printed as a part of --help output
        handler - converts string to wanted type.
        Returns:
        handler

      • getOptionHelp

        public java.lang.String getOptionHelp()
        Return a String with a list of all options and their description. Ends with a newline if not empty. You probably want to prepend getUsage()\n

      • getHelp

        public java.lang.String getHelp(boolean only_usage,
                                java.lang.String help)
        generate --help output as "$help\n${getUsage()}"Options:\n${getOptionHelp()}" Ends with a newline. Should be called after checking for positional arguments!
        Parameters:
        only_usage - is --quiet set?
        help - text to be displayed before usage and option help, should end with a newline.

      • handle_version

        public void handle_version(char shortOpt,
                           java.lang.String versionInfo)
        If --version is set, print versionInfo and exit(0).
        Parameters:
        shortOpt - should be 'v' or '\0' If there is a -q--quiet flag, you should only show the version number if it was set.

      • handle_version

      • volume

        public int volume(java.lang.String verbose_description,
                  java.lang.String quiet_description,
                  java.lang.String silent_description)
        Add options -v--verbose -q--quiet and -s--silent. if silent is last -2 is returned, else volume = times verbose - 1 if quiet or silent was set.

      • optFlagLast

        public java.lang.String optFlagLast(java.lang.String none,
                                    java.lang.Object... opts)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Find the last of multiple flags. useful when you have several options that negate each other.
        Parameters:
        none - is returned if no flags were set.
        opts - repeated parameters to optFlag(), eg shortOpt, longOpt, help, shortOpt, longOpt, Help, ... 3*n+0 must be Character 3*n+1 must be String or null 3*n+2 must be String or null.
        Returns:
        the longOpt (or shortOpt if longOpt is null) of the last set option, or none if no flags were set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • optStr

        public java.lang.String optStr(char shortOpt,
                               java.lang.String longOpt,
                               java.lang.String description)
        Returns:
        null if not set.

        Add an option that require a path argument and open it for writing.
        Parameters:
        append - append to file instead of overwriting.
        Returns:
        null if not set or System.out if "-".
